pros: Pay is competitive. More than Sutter, but less than Kaiser. Benefits if you use their HMO are outstanding. Proactive leadership trying to keep Northbay independent. Open and transparent with finances and where things are at and what is being done to help the organization.
cons: Parking is a real pain. They really should invest in a parking structure or something.

pros: I was paid well for my duties and most staff were conscientious about doing exceptional work
cons: All negatives stem from inflexibility which forces choices one shouldn't have to make

pros: Competitive pay with somewhat good benefits
cons: need more staff to be more efficient with patient care

job_title: Central Services Technician in Fairfield, CA
pros: good starting pay was nice
cons: they don't give you a raise every year

review_title: Used to be the BEST place to work....Not so much anymore
job_title: Revenue Cycle Specialist in Fairfield, CA
pros: Great pay and benefits. They do a lot for the community.
cons: After several members of senior management retired and/or left, the company changed in a negative direction. They used to foster a family feel towards employees. Now its all about the almighty dollar. They outsource nearly the entire Revenue Cycle Management department. They laid off a large part of the workforce to do it. I used to really love it there but the culture changed. It is not the same anymore and I am happy I am no longer there.

pros: Small hospital feel with bigger hospital resources.
cons: Staffing shortages, but that’s everywhere right now.

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Fairfield, CA
pros: - Great leadership and management - Competitive pay - Learning opportunities - Small hospital = positive relationships with staff and providers
cons: - Small hospital = limited locations - Location

review_title: It used to be a great place
job_title: Clinical Nurse II in Fairfield, CA
pros: -Pay is comparable to other hospitals in the area
cons:
-Self-scheduling, it is nice until they flex you. PTO denials happen often due to staffing. The Leads of the unit do the schedule which leads to conflict of interest and favoritism. Staffing does not make the schedule like everywhere else.
-If you call out sick, you HAVE to text the manager why you're calling out sick (and they hide this illegal practice by calling it "covid" triage). HR is aware and they do not care.
-Chronically short-staffed, high turnover rate
-Opportunities to move into other specialities or days shifts is difficult.
-There is no union here yet management always speaks about "seniority" when they show preference to there staff members. 
-Unsafe high acuity assignments
-Missed breaks, missed meals happen often.
-No pension 
-Recent changes to the 403 (b) retirement plan which are not good.

pros: Good co workers Management is approachable
cons: Too much work and not enough staff, usual health care problem.

pros: They give step raised and sometimes cost of living raises
cons: They wages for RNs are not competitive

pros: manager was flexible but she is no longer there
cons: delay of care for patient care

pros: Friendly work environment very helpful and hands on learning
cons: None that I can think of

pros: Have worked at NB in varying units for nearly two decades. This employer has higher Nurse retention rate than other hospitals in the area.
cons: Seniority does not matter at all when applying for a different position in your unit or another unit. Neither does it matter with a change in hours worked within your same unit . It all hinges upon the letters behind your name and the luck of the draw in how you are scored with your peers during the mandatory interview process with ANY change in position or FTE.

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Fairfield, CA
pros:
Competitive pay

Family-like culture 

Trauma center which provides ample learning opportunities 

Supportive management 

Awesome educational and professional support
cons:
Not a union (may or may not be a problem for some employees!)

Limited benefits/insurance options for employees - no PPO option. 

Hard to get a shift that isn’t overnight (also may not be a deal breaker.)

job_title: Senior Financial Analyst in Fairfield, CA
pros: Direct leadership / management team is great. They are kind and will always help out with work. Overall everyone at the company is very nice and you will learn a lot about the healthcare and hospital industry.
cons: No bonus due to Covid. Also no support using the software tools needed for the role (from 3rd party) spent a lot of time trying to fix small data issues which takes up too much time. Also no growth trajectory.

pros: Small town vibes with decent patient load. Great learning hospital.
cons: Lay offs have killed the close vibe we had.

pros: Great pay and fast pace environment

pros: Great place to work at.

review_title: NorthBay HealthCare live up to its tag line of "You'll Love it Here".
pros:
1. People that work there care about the patient's and their co-workers.
2. Management listens
3. Small enough to care about the details, but large enough to be able to provide excellent care.
4. Long term employement is rewarded
5. Staff care about each other, you are a part of a team.
6. They live their values daily.
cons:
1. The non-profit communiy hospital environment in California can be frustrating because you have limited financial resources.
2. Would like them to be able to provide medical benefits to retirees.

pros: Great place to get experience and build a  strong work ethic and ethical practices. Turnover allows for ample opportunities
cons: People are treated as disposable, unless they have established relationships with senior management. Turnover indicates serious problems within departments.

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Vacaville, CA
pros: Coworkers are fun, you get a $30 gift card to the gift store every year, small hospital with a community feel which allows us all to get to know each other.
cons: Lack of clearly defined roles so often times staff members are voluntold to wear different hats which leads to burn out.   Have a manager at the office at all times for communication and support.

pros: Good C-Suite management at the time I was there. Offered every opportunity to grow at department level and within the organization. Valid ideas are fully supported. Financially sound model. Location is within reach of anything you might like to do in your time off.
cons: Small healthcare system size may be a detractor for some. Suburban setting may be challenging for "young and single" professionals.

pros: Hours are negotiable. Community is near Napa, San Francisco, and Lake Tahoe. Schools are average to excellent.  Management is very sensitive to physician needs.
cons: Summers can be quite hot. Water is not so plentiful and we may have to ration during any given year. This community has some areas that may be considered unsafe.

pros:
Close to Bay area salary
Great benefits (PTO, ESL, 403b, vision, dental, medical)
Potential for advancement
Family work environment
cons:
Poor communication between upper management and "working class"
A lot of politics between departments
Departments work in silo's
A lot of "red tape" making it difficult to make improvements 
New hire process takes forever
Difficult financial times (like most health systems)

job_title: Clinical Nurse II in Vacaville, CA
pros: The staff, the resources, the education provided, the mission. This is a place to stick with. Tuition reimbursement, competitive pay, self scheduling and an open and supportive environment. I love it.
cons: With all the growth, we need more staff. Management is working on that and it takes time to hire the right people and put them through training.

pros: Very close family hospital. Easy to get comfortable in the hospital setting and learn the protocols. Very fast pace but there is there days where you can slow down.
cons: When you work in the on-call position, it can be self taught situations. It can be a little overwhelming but the department is good with working with you.
